page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: ECOLOGY ------- SOILS MIXED;MOSTLY SAND ON GRAVEL EXCEPT IN STREAM VALLEYS.STREAM RUNS FROM PERCH LAKE TO THE RIVER BURE. GRAZED WATER MEADOWS AND CARR.GOOD SELECTION OF WATER AND MARSH PLANTS AND BIRDS.SOME AREAS OVER 30M.BUT MOST IS 15M.OR LESS.TWO AREAS OF COMMON LAND - "THE HILL" IS SANDY WITH GORSE, BROOM AND HEATHER;"LOW COMMON" IS BOGGY WITH SILVER BIRCH DOMINANT. ONE AREA OF PERMANENT WOODLAND - HARD WOODS(ASH,OAK,SWEET CHESTNUT) AND CROPPED SPRUCE AND FIR.MANY WOODLAND BIRDS.TWO SMALL AREAS OF OPEN WATER ATTRACT DUCK.A FAIR NETWORK OF FOOTPATHS SELDOM USED AND IN DANGER OF BEING LOST.MUCH OF AREA INTENSIVELY FARMED WITH SUBSEQUENT LOSS OF HEDGES,DITCHES AND TREES.OVERUSE OF HERBICIDE & PESTICIDE POLLUTES THE BEC
